titles.title: Children's Health Protection and Eligibility Act of 2003
A bill to amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to extend the availability of allotments to States for fiscal years 1998 through 2000, and for other purposes.
Children's Health Protection and Eligibility Act of 2003

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: Children's Health Protection and Eligibility Act of 2003 - Amends title XXI (State Children's Health Insurance Program) (SCHIP) of the Social Security Act to: (1) provide for the retention and redistribution through FY 2004 of SCHIP allotments for FY 1998 through 2000; and (2) authorize qualifying States to use SCHIP funds for Medicaid expenditures.
